data.title: Lunch
data.text: Great Sandwich shop. Boars head meat and soft rolls. Everything tasted great and the place was very clean. Staff was very attentive and helpful.  Highly recommend this place!!

data.title: Great lunch spot
data.text: Great sandwiches and coffee it is where the locals go for lunch while at work. nice staff clean friendly

data.title: Nothing special
data.text: Sandwich was fine but wouldn't go out of my way to get one here.  There are plenty of other sub places within a mile stretch to get more for your money (firehouse, subway and other local shops and even Publix deli).   I got a turkey sub with extra cheese and large tea and was $9.73 which is a little high considering it was a lot of bread and little very thin slices of turkey.

data.title: Best Melbourne area sandwiches we've found!
data.text:
As transplants from New England, we have been on a disappointing search for good subs (we call them grinders up North) since we've been here.  We passed Peppertree in Palm Bay on one of our local trips and decided to give it a try.

We were very pleased with their cheesesteak sub, made just like we requested.  The bread was fresh, the meat was plentiful and the service was outstanding.  We weren't too impressed with the pastrami.

We highly recommend Peppertree.

data.title: Good... not great
data.text: We went at noon.  Maybe it was the hour but it's difficult for the servers to work with pressure not making us as customers feel welcomed and warm because they have to 'rush'.   The food was good, not great. My husband ordered a Gyro combo.  A good amount of french fries would've been great (small amount).   The Gyro was good, but not great, also was my pastrami sandwich.   I have eat better sandwiches in other places.  It was not a great experience.

data.title: Looked like a nice place to stop for lunch
data.text:
Was in the area and decided to stop for lunch. First time in and I was overwhelmed by the variety oN the menu. Mostly serving Boars Head  cold cuts and homemade salads. There are some hot subs as well. I opted for a small 7 inch meatball sub with provolone cheese.  It was very good. Meatballs were tender and tasty and could have used two  more on the sub. Cheese was very sparse. Tomato sauce came on the side as requested and it was delicious. Bun was wholewheat, toasted and very fresh. A good choice, but one of the more pricier subs at $5.75 for a small.  Place was cheery and clean and servers were nice.
There are many such restaurants located close to the HARRIS Industries, open from the morning to 3:oo pm to catch the lunch crowd. There could be better deals out there in the neighbourhood so I've heard.

data.title: Average Sandwich Shop - there are better ones
data.text:
Had the grilled Reuben. Was OK but have had better. Worth driving the 20 minutes to get to Don's Famous Hoagies nearby for theirs.
Grandson had a roast beef - not a whole lot of meat on the sub. Mom had the ham/turkey special - she seemed to be happy. 
Some salads - 4-bean, potato, etc are available, and also some fruit salads/bowls.
Was OK, but would probably not return.

data.title: Great Subs
data.text: Small, out of the way, sandwich shop that reminds me of the way a sandwich used to be. Good value. I have never been dissappointed.

data.title: Unsanitary Food Prep in past
data.text: I eat at Pepper Tree maybe once a month and it is pretty good food overall. I would go more often but I have been turned off too many times by the people that make the sandwiches also handle money when people pay for orders and also answer the phones.... and then never wash their hands or put on gloves to make your food. This kind of grossed me out. When I do go now I demand they wear gloves but, honestly the management should know better. The cold sandwiches are better then the hot ones, soups are hit an miss with almost no seasoning and just hot water with vegetables and meat in it.The pasta and macaroni salad is good and the place is clean and friendly. This could be a much better sandwich shop.

data.title: The place gets really busy at lunch
data.text:
I've been here a couple of times, but needed to walk out once because the service was so slow, and I had an appointment that I couldn't be late for.
The one time that I did eat there, it was good, but there are not too many sandwich shops that I would rate higher than good.  The workers are worked, and try to get the food out as quickly as they can.  They also have a drive through that seems to slow things down a bit too.
Sorry that I can't say much more about the place, but I will give you the heads up that a lot of people go there and it's not an in and out place to go if you can't wait during lunch.  Oh, and parking might also be challenging...

data.title: Was hoping for better
data.text: I've tried the place twice and really wanted to love it, but just didn't get the warm fuzzies from the food. Both times I went, the service was friendly and efficient, but the food was just average. The first time, I tried the chicken teriyaki sub. The sauce was heavy and strongly flavored. It struck me as something you might buy in a jar. Stumbled across one fatty/gristly piece of chicken, but there was plenty of meat on the sandwich. The second time, I got a veggie sub. They had a large selection of vegetables, but it just didn't come together like the veggie subs I get at Subway. The whole wheat bread wasn't that great either. A little on the dry side, with almost no flavor. A friend I was with had the fried fish sandwich and she wasn't wow'd either. I doubt we'll return which is a shame as it's in a location convenient for our offices.

data.title: Average
data.text: Stopped in for lunch and had a medium cheese steak sub.  It was spicy loaded but there was little meat and cheese and the meat was fatty but the bread was good.
